--- title: VainPy keywords: fastai sidebar: home_sidebar summary: "VainPy refers to Vasp analysis in numerical Python as it is based on numpy, alogwith xml ElementTree package in python." description: "VainPy refers to Vasp analysis in numerical Python as it is based on numpy, alogwith xml ElementTree package in python." ---
{% raw %}
{% endraw %}

This file will become your README and also the index of your documentation.

Install

pip install VainPy

How to use

{% raw %} 
from VainPy import vr_parser as vp
xml_data=vp.read_asxml(path='../vasprun.xml')
vr=vp.export_vasprun(xml_data=xml_data)
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
vr.keys()

dict_keys(['sys_info', 'dim_info', 'kpoints', 'kpath', 'bands', 'tdos', 'pro_bands', 'pro_dos', 'poscar', 'xml'])
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
vp.exclude_kpts(xml_data=xml_data)

{'skipk': 10}
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
vp.get_summary(xml_data=xml_data)

{'SYSTEM': 'AlAs',
 'NION': 2,
 'TypeION': 2,
 'ElemName': ['Al', 'As'],
 'ElemIndex': [0, 1, 2],
 'ISPIN': 1}
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import numpy as np
en=vr.tdos.tdos[:,0]
dos=vr.tdos.tdos[:,1]
dplot=plt.plot(en,dos)
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
k=vr.kpath
ef=vr.bands.E_Fermi
evals=vr.bands.evals-ef
plot=plt.plot(k,evals,'b')
{% endraw %}
